metadata.title: CVE-2015-7529 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
sosreport in SoS 3.x allows local users to obtain sensitive informationfrom sosreport files or gain privileges via a symlink attack on an archivefile in a temporary directory, as demonstrated bysosreport-$hostname-$date.tar in /tmp/sosreport-$hostname-$date.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7529` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sosreport - 3.1-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sosreport package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1-1ubuntu2.2').
